thread.title: Te Maire Martin turned down NRL greats to stick with Panthers - Yahoo7
thread.title_full: Te Maire Martin turned down NRL greats to stick with Panthers - Yahoo7

author: On February
title: Te Maire Martin turned down NRL greats to stick with Panthers - Yahoo7
text:
Share Te Maire Martin turned down NRL greats to stick with Panthers - Yahoo7 He was wooed by some of the greats of the game but even Johnathan Thurston and Cooper Cronk were not enough to convince youngster Te Maire Martin to sign with their clubs. Close Cleary excited by Panthers potential UP NEXT VIDEO Cleary excited by Panthers potential Cleary excited by Panthers potential 
Instead he opted for Penrith, and his halves partner couldn't be happier. 
Nathan Cleary's been having a ball, and now he's got a partner in crime. 
"It's pretty cool, you know, a lot of people would want to be in this position. Definitely can't take it for granted," Cleary told 7 News reporter Josh Massoud. 
Martin has enjoyed training with a fellow youngster. 
"Everyone's said how calm he is. He does a lot of training. He's not very calm, his driving is pretty shocking," he said. Te Maire Martin. Pic: Getty 
Who'll take the steering wheel on the field is anyone's guess. 
This is easily the NRL's youngest halves combination. 
The pair boast a combined age of just 40 and have played a grand total of just 21 NRL games. 
But Martin could have been doing his apprenticeship elsewhere. 
In 2015 he travelled to Townsville to meet Johnathan Thurston. 
"Seeing him around I just wanted to go there straight away," Martin said. Cooper Cronk and Johnathan Thurston. Pic: Getty 
Then he had a chat with Cooper Cronk in Melbourne. 
"I was really nervous around him. It was quite freaky but cool at the same time. I was quite close to going there," he added. 
Cleary was glad he stayed. 
"I suppose Penrith offered him the opportunity and he broke into the team straight away, so I don't suppose he's looked back." 
Saturday's clash against the Dragons will be the first time these two youngsters have joined forces at NRL level. Nathan Cleary. Pic: Getty 
But they've previously gone head to head in the under-20s, the honours evenly split. 
"Beat me. He's got one up," Cleary said. 
Martin, however, wouldn't know: "I got concussed, I don't remember too much about it." 
Surfing and golf are now their competitive passions. 
"He's a better surfer but I'll take golf," Cleary said, with Martin saying he "can't stand golf".
